page.title: 07THE GREEN IN WIS. GREEN
page.content: The Green was, originally, used by the villagers as pasture. At the western end is a memorial to the men of the village who were killed in the wars of 1914-18 and 1939-45. There is a flagpole where a flag is flown on special occasions. The Green is now used as a meeting place for many outdoor activities. In winter, football is played, while, in summer, the men play cricket and the women play stoolball and croquet. On the last Monday in August, the Flower show is held in a large tent. Local gardeners vie with each other to produce the best exhibits while cooks display their cakes and children show their craftwork. In September the fair arrives with rides and sideshows and occasionally a small circus will set up to entertain the villagers.
